It is a combination of both.<n>####  D<n>Answer:<n>Answer: <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>When we want something from someone by way of a command or request, we use a question phrase that begins with a what? Choices: A: question mark (?) B: conjunction (and) C: interrogative exclamation point (!) D: personal pronoun (which) E: imperative (please)<n><n>When we want someone to do something for US, we use what word/phrase to show that the action should be done immediately rather than after considering the benefits. Choices: A: conjunction (or) B: imperative(don't) C: pronoun (he/she/it) D: adverb (never) E: preposition (to)<n><n>We don't ask questions in what? Choices: The way we ask a question is always a question mark (?) or a question exclamation point (!).<n>Even in a short response or command, which form would NOT be used? Choices: A. A question mark (?) B. A question exclamation point (!!)  C. A question with a comma (?,) D. A question in a statement (!,) E. A question with a punctuation mark at the end of the sentence (?)<n><n>We use the what to give a command or request that isn't directly asking a question and doesn't require an answer? Choices: <n><n>We use what mark to indicate a command or request when the speaker expects an immediate answer? Choices:<n>We use what word when we want a particular person to read the information that follows the sentence? Choices:  What is the correct name of the command/question form? Choices:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Incorrect Example <n><n>HELP<n><n>HELP! <n><n>Rationales: Incorrect
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What could you do if you want to listen to music? Choices:  A: skate B: play piano C: fiddle D: play piano E: have fun<n><n>### Response:		<n>- if I want to listen to music, I play piano because I love it and enjoy playing with friends.<n><n>### Input I hope this letter can make you happy and you have a good life. <n><n>### Response<n>- Dear Luna,<n>- I hope this letter can help you to have a good life and be happy. Your friend, Leni<n><n>### Input What other games can you play on PlayStation? <n><n>### A response<n>- you can play games on a different device but you need to buy a PS4 and an extra game because its expensive.<n><n>### Dear Mrs. Owens-Brown<n>- This is a great honor to receive an envelope with a scholarship opportunity but I'm going to go with a friend.<n><n>### We are the most important person in our lives then there are things in life I'm 100 percent sure I'll do for myself.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. Choices:  A: self pity B: communication C: understood D: pain E: embarrassment<n><n>### Response:		In yelling, you are communicating. In order to communicate, there is a receiver, and that receiver may understand what is being communicated or not. When you are communicating with someone, you are also expressing yourself to them. The person may or may not understand what you’re trying to express, and you may or may not understand that person. Yelling about the pain of a bruise does not express self pity to the listener. A person yells when they have been hurt. Since yelling is an expression of pain, there is no self pity in yelling, only pain.<n><n>### Input :Sally got a dollar for doing six chores. She was trying to raise money for a pet kitten. She gave the first dollar to her parents in exchange for a dollar. The rest went to her piggy bank for the pet. How many chores did she do in the end?<n><n>### Input Solution:Sally wanted to give her parents $1, so 1+1 =<<1+1=2>>2. She had $7 left and put it in her piggy bank<n><n>### The next problem can be solved with 23.<n><n>### But there are 12 ways to solve it. Use variables to represent the values you should subtract. Then write an expression that represents the expression in the problem.<n><n>### If you subtract first, choose a variable to represent the one, then use the same variable to solve for the other.

The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What do people who are speech therapists do? Choices:  A: make music B: believe in god C: give speeches D: complete sentences E: build houses<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He had been doing favors for everybody at work, it was frustrating not getting any what for it? So he had to make up his mind to stop.<n><n>#### Explanation 1:<n>He had been doing favours for everybody at work; it [was] frustrating not getting [any] satisfaction...<n><n>#### Explanations 2:<n>He had been doimg favours for everybody at at work [it] was frustrating,  not getting any satisfaction [for it]? So he had to make uup his mind to stop. <n><n>### Exercise:1-6,9,10 Expand the statement in each of your boxes until it makes<n>sense, using appropriate words. Write your expanded statements in the lines that follow.<n><n>Input: The train was ten minutes late, so we couldn’t meet the people we were supposed to meet.<n><n>Output: At the train station, our train was ten minutes [late]. So [I ] couldn’t meet the 9 o clock people i  was supposed <n>to meet i [at] 9o'clock**<n><n>#### 9<n>Answer: 9:09<n><n>**Input:   I just had to pay all of it before I could get the car.**<n><n><n>Expansions:  I was just [have to] pay [all of it],  before I could get [my] car.<n><n>**Expansions:**<n>I was just [have to]/ before I could get my car.<n><n>#### 10<n>Answer: 9 o'clock<n><n>#### <n>Answer: 1 o'clock<n><n>### Input 1: I've got a little more money than him now. <n><n><n><n>Output(1):I've got [a] lot more money than [him] now.<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What did the business require of everyone walking into their store? If it is one it is a success: (1/6)<n>Otherwise, re-roll the die if you don’t want to see another result.<n>If it is not one, then you were not successful. We calculate the probability of rolling a one as 1/6. If the number you pick is not 1/6, that’s re-rolling.<n>#### 20<n>Answer: 0.16<n><n>### Instructions: Write a response that corresponds to the task below.<n>#### Input:<n>If you roll a fair die for 4 times and you get 3 sixes, what is your chance to get 3 sixes?<n><n>#### Response:<n><n>##### Input:<n>You want to take a picture of yourself on a cloud and you ask your friend whether they want to take the picture with you.<n><n>##### Response:<n>You take a picture of yourself and take the photo to your friend<n><n>##### Input 2:<n>John likes to play chess and he asks you whether you can play chess with him after school.<n><n>##### Answer 2:<n>Yes. What is the number?<n><n>### RATIONALES<n>The sum of (N) and 3 = the sum of (N-2) + (N-1)3<n>Now since (N-2)+(N-1)3 = N, N = (N-2)+ (N-1) + 3<n><n>### Response :<n>3<n><n>### Answer:<n>N is 3+2+1 = 6

Choices:  a) adding salt b) putting in sugar c) pouring hot oil d) adding spices e) all of the above<n><n>### Demostration.<n>Input: What is the best way to make pizza taste better?<n>Choices: a) adding salt b. pouring hot oil c) adding spices d) all of the above.<n>Answer: b) pouring hot oil<n><n>### Input<n>Dear Mr. John,<n><n>When we are happy what do we do?<n><n>Answers:  smile<n><n>thinking<n><n>get along<n><n>I appreciate the letter and the present.<n><n>### 1<n>Answer: A: I appreciate the letter and the gift.<n><n>### Requirement<n>You should write a response that appropriately answers to the following requirement.<n>Rationales: Smile<n><n>### Input When we are thankful for something what do we do?.<n><n>C: showing appreciation<n><n>E: show appreciation<n>A: show appreciation<n>D: put a smile<n><n>### 2<n>Answer: D: put a smile,show appreciation<n><n>## Instructions:<n>#### Instruction:Write the letter,<n>Dear Mr. _John_<n><n>#### Demonstration:Dear sir,<n>I got 1 mark in the first test<n><n>#### Input:<n>#### Answer<n>Write me a letter? [32.99] - Instru
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Some might say that if you want to do something that results in changing society then you need to start from within, to do this what would you be doing? Choices:  A: riots B: vote C: change yourself D: social activism E: change clothes<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> A: riots - This is not the way to change the society, you can’t change anything in a hurry by rioting. There is a reason why some people think that riots are just a cry that would be heard but nothing comes from it. It only brings trouble within its community. Change will only happen by working hard and trying to be a citizen of our community.<n><n>So, I agree with the first part, changing yourself. You need to learn to start thinking like an activist and then become an activist so that you can use your abilities to change the society for a better tomorrow.<n><n>------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n><n>### Input:\_\_When the two sides in a tug of war decide to join forces and work together they form a cart that can be pulled by either side. The mass of the cart is shared between its two halves, so the total mass of the system is given by? \_\_<n><n>### Demostration:\_\_<n>Answer:\_\_<n>(In your words and drawings)<n>----------------------------------<n><n>### Solution:<n>The answer to this question is: $$\frac{(A + a)^2-a^2}{4}+$$<n>$$\frac{(B + b)^2-b^2}{4},$$<n>A: The total mass of the cart + the cart itself<n>```<n>A = (A+a)<n>A = (A-a) + a<n>A = (A - 2a + a)/2<n>```<n>```<n>a = A/2 - (A/2),<n>a = -(A/2)/2<n>```<n><n>```<n>B: The total mass of just Cart itself<n>```<n>```<n>B=B+b<n>B = (B-b)/2 or B = B/2+b/2<n>```<n><n>Total mass:<n>```<n>Total Mass = A + B<n>```<n><n>$$\frac{(A + a)}{a}+\frac{(B+b)}{b}=b,$$<n>$$\frac{1}{a}+\frac{1}{b}=b.$$<n>$$ b = ab + b + a,$$<n>$$b = ab(1 + 1).$$<n>$$b = 2ab,$$<n>$$a+b(=a+a+a+b.)<n>b = 2a+a<n>b =

He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would form on your feet, if you were jogging all day? Momma (PLEASE DO NOT CHANGE ANY OF THE WORDS!!!)<n><n>### Response:(In the image) M<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Daughter = D<n>Father = A<n>Momma = M<n>Mom = Mom<n>Mamma = A<n>Mam = Ma (short for mamma)<n>etc<n><n>### Input ((15/4)*29*2)/9=? Choice: A. 1.95 B. 6.5 C. 6.53 D. 3.254<n>### Response: 0.7583<n>### Rationale<n><n>Answer: $(15/4)*(29*2)/(9) = 1.95 \cdot 2.9/9 = 0.75\cdot 9/9 = 9/9 =1$<n><n>We need to solve for 29/4, because we get $29/4=2\cdot (15/4) = 15/4$<n><n>We need $\frac{29}{4} = 0.705$<n><n>We need $0.705 \cdot 4 = 2.82$<n><n>Then $2.82 + 2.9 = \frac{5.72}{9} = 0.6277 \approx 0.63$<n><n>Answer: $(0.75 - 0.6293) = 0.1207$<n><n>###<n><n>### Instructions are not in the original question.<n><n>## Input: How much does a shark weigh.<n><n>## Response: An African Elephant.<n><n>## Rationale:<n><n>## Input: Two plus two times four equals eight plus eight.<n><n>## Response(In the picture): 5<n><n>## Rationale(In the picture) <n><n>### Instructiion: What is the sum of the digits in the number 862

This would be a C.<n><n>### Input A:<n>```<n>A student is preparing a test that has 15 multiple choice questions and 30 fill in the blank questions<n>```<n>### Input B:<n>```<n>A group of six friends planned<n>```<n>### Response (to answer input A.) <n>```<n><n>### Response (in answer input B)<n>```<n>Answer C because when you are confused you may just go to a wrong location.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The graveyard was important to build, where should it be built? Choices:  A: arlington B: church property C: out back D: every town E: cemetery<n><n>### Response:		Which of the following best completes the following statement? "If the students decided to raise the $600 for the graveyard, they should have purchased a cemetery located in the back of the school." <n><n>### Input:(Spoiler alert: This is a trick question!)<n>For the purpose of this assessment, choose the letter on the right.<n><n>For this question, the question was asked "Where should the graveyard be built?" <n>In the choices, there is "out back D: every town" which is confusing the student because the word "out" could mean it's outside of the school not in the back<n><n>In the original wording, the correct answer is 'D'. However, because of the word choice made in 'out back D: everytown', the incorrect answer selection 'C' got selected.<n><n>The correct answer is "D".<n><n>### Answer A: arlington<n><n>### Answer B: church property<n><n>### Answer C: out back <n>- This is a trick question.<n>- A student could mistakenly choose this as answer when the student interprets the words 'out back' as a phrase<n>`<anything goes here, you can choose this phrase as one of the answer.>`<n><n>### Answer D: every town<n>- This is a tricky question.<n>- While this answer is correct in terms of the question wording, it is not correct in the answer section! <n><n>### Answer E: cemetery<n>- In a traditional assessment for multiple choice, it is not possible to provide a response such as 'every town'.<n>A student could reasonably decide to create an answer section as shown above<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is the opposite of hosting a crowd? Choices:  A: few people B: pay debts C: individual D: single person E: small group<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>A person that host a small crowd is 1-20 people.<n>Therefor the opposite is less than this number.<n><n>Few people means < 20.<n>Paying debts doesn't make sense in this context either.<n>Indeed, in the context of Hosting a crowd, I would expect the opposite to be about the people. This might be confusing since I may expect more from Hosting than from few people. To clarify, we can say that fewer people than 20 makes sense. So, fewer than 20 is indeed an opposite.<n><n>Paying debts sounds like a business decision and it is out of the context.<n>Also "individual" is misleading when we expect less than 20 <n><n>Personally, I would say:<n>Individual is the opposite of crowd.<n>However, the options provided don't include this option and hence I don't have another right answer<n><n>### Instructions:<n>What is the correct ratio of 1: 3 8?<n><n>### Option:<n><n>2 : 4<n><n>### Answer:<n>B. 2 : 4<n>

Choices:  A: problems B: not noticeable C: deflation D: economic instability E: eat cake<n><n>### Response:		It could cause not noticeable problems.<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>When you fight inflation successfully, it means that you keep the price at the level that you are used to (which is, the same as the inflation). This is why you can just fight inflations (this means do nothing). The result is then that the inflation is not noticeable and there won't be any problems.<n><n>## Input:If the GDP rises from $200 million to $222 million, the GDP increases<n><n>## Explanation:<n>$$<n>\begin{aligned}<n>1 &+& 1 = &2 \\<n>2 &+& 1 & = &3 \\<n>3 &+& 2 = &5 \\<n>\end{aligned}<n>$$<n>There is no way of calculating GDP that has been done wrong.<n><n>## Input What is the sum of all the prime numbers from 2 through 29? Choices: 1987<n><n>## Explanatino:<n>The sum of all the prime number from 2-29 is:<n>$$<n>\sum_{number} 2<n>$$<n>As we know, the sum of all prime number from 1-29 (because we skip 1 as it is not prime) is 1987

In addition, you want to make 30 liters of diluted bleach. You decide to use each quart(0.95 L) to the liter measurement for what you need. What amount of each liquid do you need to add to your 26 liter can to create that amount of diluted bleach?<n><n>### Demostration <n>Start with 26 Liters of Chlorine<n>- (30/4) 26 (liters of chlorine)<n><n>Start again after 0.5 liters<n>- 0.5 litres of chlorine = 0.5* 26<n>- 0.30 = 13.5 ounces of bleach<n><n>Total: 26 liters - 13.5 oz = 3 3/4 quarts or 0.95 liters of bleach<n><n>#### 3 3/8<n>Answer: 3 3/5ths (Quarter)<n><n><n>### Input <n><n>- Your birthday is next year, September 9th, but you want to wear a shirt to represent your birthday. Blue for September 30<n>- What color shirt do you wear?<n>- Rationales:<n>- 9 is not in the birthday list so that is a sign.<n><n><n>### Solution <n>9 is not in the list, so 9 is the pick, no color match. <n><n><n>#### 9<n>Answer: 9<n><n>

Jake has $1.94 left in his piggy bank. To the nearest nickel, how much does Jake have left in his piggie bank?<n>Answer: $<<.94>>0.94<n><n>### Demand:<n>Input: Mr Adams wants to know how many chairs his classroom needs for exactly 15 children.<n>Rationales: Mr Adams wants to have exactly 15 children per chair = <<15/1>>1.<n>He wants 15 per chair + 15 = <<15*15>30>>30 chairs in total.<n>To the nearest chair, his classroom needs an answer of 31 chairs.<n><n>#### 31<n>Answer: 31<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you carry a pen as you go through your day? Choices:  A: pocket B: office supply store C: friend's house D: desk drawer E: city hall<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Explanation<n>Answers can be considered in a tree fashion where A, B,C,D and E could in turn become parent questions. However, in this case A, B and D are disregarded because they would never lead to an answer, which means that if you get an answer from asking A, B or D, you would know for certain it was not correct, which is not what we are looking for here. E would be the answer, since it is not in a parent question.<n><n>## Resources:<n>[Ask Question](https://discuss.codecombat.com/)<n>[Course Forums](https://community.codecombat.org/t/course-forums)

Give a number that is a solution to the inequality.<n><n>### Response A:<n>The solution is 20.<n><n>### Solution A:<n>Subtract 40 and get 10, square it to 100, and subtract 50 get 50, then subtract three to get 47.<n><n>### A + B = B<n>A + C + D = E<n>If you could only pick one of the above, which one would you pick and why: A: Love, B: Necessity, C: Inspiration, D: Fun<n><n>### Response B:<n>Cause if you are lazy it shows you care more about yourself.<n><n>### Comment B:<n><n>### Instructor: Which of the following statements are true. Please check all that apply.<n><n>### Choice:<n>Hurley is older than Richard; Richard is older than 18; and Hurley is younger than 18.<n><n>### Option A and B:<n>Hurley could be Hurley, however, Richard is older then 18.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:How can you get the attention of a person across the room? Choices:  A: board ship B: shout at C: smile at D: cross street E: feel happy<n><n>### Response:		What is the correct sequence to read the instructions?<n><n>1. Start typing instructions for this task.<n>Input: The difference between the smallest prime number and the sum of its factors, including the number itself, is 6. What is the prime number?<n>Rationales:(6 + 1) x 10^9 = <<6+1*10^9=601>> 601<n>(601 - 2)/2 = <<(601-2)/2=300,750>> 300750<n>The difference is 300749<n>####300748<n><n>Answer:300741<n><n>1. Click next button.<n>2. Click Start button.<n>3. Click Next button.<n>4. Give answer.<n>5. Click Start button. Your answer was correct. You answered <<300742>>300743<n><n>### Output:<n>The difference between the smallest prime and its sum of factors, including the number is 10. The prime number is 300,742.<n><n>### Analysis:<n>```C#<n>using System;<n><n>public class Program<n>{<n>    static void Main()<n>    { <n>        Rationales: // The difference between the smallest Prime number and the sum of it factors is a constant of 6<n>        double x = 1_000_000_double; <n>        double y = x;<n>        x += y;<n>        Console.WriteLine();<n>        Console.WriteLine("");<n>        Console.WriteLine(Calculate("6 + "));<n>        Console.WriteLine($"It's sum ");<n>        x -= y;<n>        Console.WriteLine($"The difference must be");<n>        Console.Write(Calculate($"( {x} - 2)"));<n>        Console.WriteLine((x - 2) / 2);<n>        Console.ReadKey(true); <n>    }<n>    public static string Calculate(string prime)<n>    {<n>        double[] numberslist = Convert.ToInt32(prime).ToArray();<n>        double[] factorlist = x*.9 > numberslist? x*.9 : numberslist;<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A shark swam in the background aquarium as the card players sat emotionless, what were they playing? Performances occurred in the school assembly hall, or on military bases. Churches did not always have theatres, but when they did they were often converted from other spaces. Opera houses are theaters for musical performance, but they are the exception to this rule.<n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n><n>**Sources cited:** <https://www.ancient.eu/Theater/The-Theater-as-a-Place-of-Performance/> <https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/theater><n><n>### Output:<n>The word is **theater**<n><n>### Input and output:<n>The word is _____.<n>**The word is **theatertheater_____**<n><n>### Dear reader input text-input, Dear reader response text-output<n><n>### Detailed Instructions<n><n>In the instructions that follow, we provide hints and examples called demos that should help you produce your response. Choices:  A B: 37 C: 29 D: 27 E:59<n><n>### Rationale:<n>"At what age did they _marry_?" Married is a verb, so it is in the _present perfect tense_. <n><n>### Choices:<n>29, 37, 59, 27, 29 are correct <n><n>### Answer:<n>"At what _age_ did she marry?"<n><n>### Input"Do you have a _bike_?  Choices: A: Car B: Bike C: Bus D: Foot E: None of the above<n><n>### Rationales:"Do you have a _(bikes)_?" pluralize the bike to see if they are talking about more than one bike, then, "Do you have a _car_?"<n><n>### Answer:"Do you have a bike?" if "bike" is singular<n><n>### Choice: "Do you have a bi__k__?" if the verb needs a verb<n><n>### InputDo you like _puns?_ Choices: A B: Puns C: _P_uns D: Words E: Not _a_ pun<n><n>### Choicesthat rhyme with pun:  pun   puns   pun    <n><n><n><n>___<n># <img src="../../../assets/bookmark/problemSolving.png"/>Problem Solving<n>___<n>### Instruction<n>Input: <font style=font-size:200 percent; color=red>Alice asks Billy to go to New York. Alice says to Billy that New York is 331 miles away.</font><n><n><font style=font-style:italic; font-size:20percent; color=grey;>How far away is New York from Alice's house?</font><n>Choices:<n>A: 165 miles B: 200 miles C: 331 miles D: 216 miles E: Can't tell<n><n>### RATIONALES<n>Start by setting up an equation
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What could someone be doing while performing that cannot be enjoyed by deaf people? Choices:  A: smile B: singing C: sweat D: act E: dance<n><n>### Response:		A is correct Answer: A<n>### Instruction for Answer:<n>The only thing in the list that cannot be enjoyed by a deaf person is singing, because when a person sings, they are using their voice which is sound.<n>Since the definition of deaf is unable to hear any sound or any form of sound, it includes singing and any other vocal sound.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:There are many cubicles in the office, they all have computers for employees to what? Choices:  A: teach B: cost money C: do work D: be productive E: help people<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions & Rationale: This response describes the task that a code monkey would be asked to accomplish.<n>### Input:How many states are in the United States? Choices: 1: 50 2: 52 3: 58 4: 400 B: 51 51 C: 53 53 <n><n>### Answer:48<n><n>### What does the question ask?<n>A 100 inch screen would stretch 48 inches wide. 100/48 = <<100/49=2>>2 times longer than 48 inches.<n><n>### How could the question be reworded?<n>How can we find the number of inches that the screen is tall?<n><n>### Input - Code<n><n>### Question: How many times is 809 divided by a given integer? <n>### Answer: 9<n><n>### Commentary: I am thinking about using division and modulo. I guess my concern is how do I deal with negative numbers?<n><n>### Answer Solution<n><n>#### Code Review<n><n>* use.modulo(<3>809)<n><n>### Inputs<n><n>* how do you do?<n><n>### Instrections<n><n>* I want to have a system <n><n>### Response<n><n>How do you want to do?<n><n>## Tests<n><n>Test that tests if the code above works correctly<n><n>### Test 1:<n>The difference is 40. If H is 16 then what are their combined ages five years from now?<n><n>### Test2:<n>A group of 7 friends planned to buy a pizza. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The human looked down longingly as he sat in the orbiting space station, what did he miss? Choices:  A: nearest house B: workplace C: surface of earth D: office block E: his feet<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### 24<n><n>### Instructions:In each of the following exercises, a problem is followed by a set of instructions. Read the problem and follow instruction to complete the exercise.<n><n>### Exercise:A) A farmer has 16 chickens. Every morning, he counts them to keep track. One morning, he counts 3 more chickens. He can't imagine when they arrived, so he continues to count all the following mornings. He wants to know the date(s) that he saw his first new chicken.<n><n>### Questions:<n><n>#### 3<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The first morning he has 16 chicken, he should have seen 3 chickens (because if 16 = 0 + 0 + 3 + 3 + 0 + 0), he should have seen 1 in total chickens that he counted.<n>Second morning he has 17 chickens, he should have seen chicken, because if 17 = 1 + 0 + 2 + 2 + 3 + 1, it shows that the day he saw chicken for first time is 2nd day.<n><n>Third morning he has 18 chickens, he didn't see any new chicken, beacause if 18 = 1 + 1 + 3 + 2 + 1 + 0 he only see 5 chicks. <n>And in fifth morning he has 20 chicken (see 1+2+3+1+0) + 2 chickens (see 3+3+1) = 20, he don't see any chicken(because 20 = 0+0)<n><n>### Exercises:B)<n>A small factory made exactly as many pants as they make shirts. How many shirts were made? Choices: 54 shirts were made or 132 pants were made<n>Rationales:<n><n>If there were 54 shirtes and 132 pant, that means, that there must have been only 6 pants. So, that means that 54+3 = <<54+3=59>>59 shirts and 10
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Sam left his muddy shoes in the entryway.  Where might he be? Sam might have left his muddy shoess in the office building when he was looking for a job or he might have left it in the garden because he was doing some gardening and doesn't want to go in the house with muddy shoes on.<n><n><n>### Input<n>What kind of tree is the fastest to lose its leaves?<n>```<n>French larch<n>Hemlock<n>Douglas fir<n>Scotch pine<n>Fir<n>```<n>### Response: <n>What kind of tree would be the fastest to lose  it's leaves? And people don't usually have to worry about being too hot most of the time. <n>I'm not sure if  I made my response clear but I hope you got the idea.<n>### Rationale<n>This is the answer I'm not sure how i got it here is how he got it fir is the right tree.<n>### Exam<n><n>### Input <n>If you take 2/12 of a cup of water, how much would you have?<n>### Rationale <n>If I take 12 then divided by 12 I would have 2 cups of water. <n><n><n>### Response <n>Your answer is 12/12.<n><n>### Rationales <n>This is actually correct but I don"t understand how so. Last year, N was 18 years old while M was 32. How old is N today?<n><n>### A. Answer:26<n><n><n>B. M is ten years younger than N. Last year N was 18years old.<n>    M was 32 years old<n><n>- Now the current year is 2014<n><n>- M is 10years younger than N<n>    - So M was 22 years old in 2005<n>    - So M should have been 12 years old in 1993<n><n>- And N was 18 in 2004<n><n>    - So N should have been 7years old in 1987<n><n>- M is older than n<n><n>- So M would have been 34 in 1988<n><n>- And N 18<n><n>- And now 2014, Nis26 years old and M is 42<n><n><n>### M =12 + 10 = 22<n><n>### N 7 +10 =17<n><n>### M M +N 5 = 37 <n><n>### N N+M = 39<n><n>### N is 26 years old<n><n>### 22+17 = 39  <n><n>### 42 + 26 = 68<n><n>### Answer:26<n>### <n>#### Solution<n>### Direction:<n>Solve the problem.<n><n>If the height of a building is 135 feet, find its volume in cubic feet. <n><n>I got that the answer for it is 1560000<n>However, the answer is 54,960 cubic feet. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. Choices:  A: cinema hall B: mall C: department store D: closet E: shop<n><n>### Response:		<n>I choose choice A "cinema hall" for the following reasons:-<n>If the clothing was extremely expensive, then it was purchased in a place where people visit for entertainment purposes like cinema halls.<n><n>#### <n>Answer: A (cinema hall)<n><n>### Input : If Jill is 22 years old, then the difference in ages between Jill and Ben is x. Jill is 4 years older than Ben. How old is Ben?<n><n>### Response :<n>It is observed in the question that Jill is 2 years older than Ben. And the difference between Jill and Ben's age is 'x'.<n><n>Now, we can write using the given information:<n>```<n>Jill's age = J<n><n>Jill's difference = x<n><n>Ben's age = J-2<n><n>x = J - 2<n><n>2x = (J-2)+2<n><n>2x=J<n><n>x=J/2<n>```<n>So, Ben's age = J/2 = 'x/2'.<n><n>#### <n><n>Answer: Ben's age = x/2.<n><n>### Input In the following statements, in each part, find the sum of the individual numbers.<n><n>### Response In the following statements, the answer would be 19.<n><n>### In part (a) the individual numbers are 4, 6, and -2<n><n>### In Part (b) the individual numbers are -6, 6, and 6<n><n>#### 19<n><n>Answer: 19<n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>Part(a). The individual numbers are 4 6 and -2 <n>```<n><n>### Response<n><n>```<n>  sum of 3 terms to the second power is the value of x.<n>  <n>  4 +6+ ( -2)^2= 19 <n>```<n><n>#### 1<n><n>Answer: -4 + 6 + (-2)^2 = -1<n><n>### Input The following statement states a numerical value. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The swimming pool couln't be refilled due to drought regulations, where was it located? Choices:  A: ymca B: california C: park D: first floor E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Option 4<n><n>#### 400<n>Answer: 200<n><n>### Option4<n>### Choice:C
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Why would a person be approached by a lot of people? For these questions, think of what is the most important thing to know to be able to find the solution.  These questions are easier in math.  They are harder in writing, science, and humanities. <n><n>### Input:"The population of Mexico City is five times the number of persons residing in Rio De Janeiro."<n><n>### Response:"The number of persons residing the city of Mexico City is five (5) times the number of persons in the city of Rio De Janeiro."<n>The key information in the question is "The population of Mexico City ". All other parts of the information given is not key information. The key information is used to help you find the solution. This information is in bold above so it is easier for you to recognize.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Inputs (Writing): <n><n>### Responses : <n><n><n>### Input (Math): The sum of the two numbers of a set is 10 and the difference of the two is 5. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. You can refer to the example task below for information.<n>Each statement starts off with main.<n>Then write out each task as a statement below your code.<n>Each statement should work independently, where each task is defined for use in one program. If you are getting any errors in your code, don’t forget to check the spelling in our textbook.<n><n>### Input<n>#### Instruction:<n>Write a program that takes a positive integer as an input and print "A" if the input is divisible by 3 or "B" if the input is not. To do this, if the input is divisble by 3, print a statement like, "The input of $$x$$ is divisble by 2."<n><n>#### Rationales<n>If the input is divisible with 3, it is divisible by 6 and 2.<n>```<n>  Input<n>      int x;<n>                          // int is a variable type, which is defined by the program.<n>      int input;<n>              // input is a variable, which is defined by a user.<n>      int y;<n>                  // y is a temporary variable.<n>      int z<n>          // z is a temporary variable. The temporary variavles are used to store the input and the integer. They are also used to test out the conditions at the last part of the code.<n>      while(z<y)<n>          // while loop keeps on repeating the steps until the condition is satisfied.<n>        z=x/3;<n>          // if the integer is divisible by 4, the divisor is multiplied by 4 before adding the divisor to the dividend.<n>       input=z;<n>       if(x%3==0)<n>             // if the remainder is 0, the statement inside the if statement is executed.<n>             System.out.println("An input of "+y+" is divisible by 2.");<n>        if(x%2==0)<n>                // if the remainder is zero, the statement inside the statement inside the if is executed.<n>                System.out.println(z+" is divisible");<n>            <n>         else System.out.println(", The input is not divisible by any number");<n>  }<n>          //}<n>}<n>```<n>#### Answer

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If people listen, they can understand each other better.  If they understand each other, they can do what? Choices:  A: pay bills B: swap bodies C: learn from each other D: believe in god E: talk to each other<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: Write C.<n><n>### Reason:<n>C is the word between A and B.<n><n>### Input : Why is the ocean blue?<n>### Response: To understand the ocean you have to learn about its layers<n><n>### Reasons:<n>### (a) It's the water above you.<n>### In the ocean there is salt water which is transparent because sunlight can be reflected<n>### because they reflect light, you cannot see through water<n>### (b) It can't. It is made of water. <n>### The deepest part is the ocean trench, which is made up of salt water.<n>### There are also living creatures in the ocean like fish, whales, and sharks<n>### (c) There's no way to measure it<n>### The ocean is so big that it's really hard to measure<n>### (d) Because it contains all of the stuff from the air<n>### Even though the ocean is mainly made of water, there are other things in it<n>### The oceans have many layers<n>### (exactly 7, but 4 to 6 aren't very obvious)<n>### The most obvious layer is saltwater. This is made of all of the salt in the world<n>###<n>####<n>Answer: (c) The ocean is just too big for me to measure. I guess the real answer is that its saline.<n><n>### If you had a million dollars, what would be the first thing you would spend it on?<n>### (a). A new car.<n>### It would be the most obvious choice you would need it to get around<n>### (b). Cars aren't that expensive. Buying a used car is probably cheaper than a brand new one.<n>### (c). College expenses. You need to prepare yourself for the future. <n>### A better job means bigger paychecks<n>### (d). You can't get a bigger thing.<n>### I think you should keep everything to yourself so nobody would steal your ideas<n>### (e). Nothing.<n>### It's better for you to save it. You can use it for a rainy day.<n>### (f). Cars.<n>### You would get at least two of them. <n>

If I _attitude_ have forgiving toward someone,  I forgive them<n><n>#### 32<n>Input: Please write a paragraph that describes the following sentence. "Mrs. Garrison was the most beautiful woman I have ever seen in my life."<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Write a response that appropriately does the following:<n><n>  * Describes sentence<n>  * Describes mood<n>  * Describes how sentence could be improved.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The sentence you gave me was about the most beautiful woman in the world I have ever seen in your life. If _I_ had written the sentence, it would have read "The most beautiful _woman_ I have ever seen." Instead of " _beautiful._ "<n>#### 24<n>Input:<n>Write a paragraph that describes your opinion on a certain person.<n><n>###  Response<n><n>I admire my classmate _Mary_. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Rumors of roving bands of monsters killing people could lead to what? Choices:  A: panic B: getting in trouble C: mass hysteria D: go to prison E: murder<n><n>### Response:		In a true story, a man got murdered because many people thought there were roving bands of monster killing them. This lead to panic and panic caused the murder.<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Rationales: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Rationales: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What happens when people are waiting for something? Choices:  A: read book B: getting bored C: worry D: singing E: s never comes<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:Write the correct response.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Input : If you drop a piece of chalk from 100 feet in the air, how long does it take to hit the ground?<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>First lets figure out our 100 feet. 100 \* 0.3048 = 31.4 meters. <n><n>To figure out the time, we need the speed of gravity. Length of descent*speed of gravity = time of descent.<n><n>31.4 \* 10 \* 9.81 = 317.3 seconds.<n><n>### Answer: R: 13<n><n>### Input  Answer: The difference in ages of Katrina and Lina is 9. Both are 13 years old, and when both are 21, Lina’s grandmother will be 125 years old. How old will Lina’s grandchild be then?
